snippet: Over the objections of the players’ union, the N.F.L.’s commissioner said he would be the one hearing an appeal of the four-game suspension he gave to the Patriots’ quarterback.
abstract: NFL Commissioner Roger Goodell, over objections of NFL Players' Assn, says he will personally hear appeal of New England Patriots quarterback Tom Brady regarding his four-game suspension; other football news noted.
lead_paragraph: Over the objections of the players’ union, the N.F.L.’s commissioner said he would be the one hearing an appeal of the four-game suspension he gave to the Patriots’ quarterback.

headline.main: Roger Goodell to Hear Tom Brady’s Appeal
